item.title: Signs, 27th August
item.description:
The signs at this location (circled) are currently: - Dead end - Pedestrian Zone - No entry. Surely it should ONLY be a No entry sign here - how can a street be No entry AND Dead end ?! Also the pedestrian zone sign - I understand this is a pedestrian zone, but this is not the entrance to the pedestrian zone! Perhaps there is a "Except cycles" sign missing - please could you clarify the situation? At present, I am sure it is wrong.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 90, Dean Street, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti, 27th August
item.description:

item.title: Why has Hackney Council left dead bushes and dead palm trees and not cut them down.Trees and bushes pose hazards to members of public,residents.Rats are nesting in the bushes causing rodent nuisance. Someone from the council could do the job properly these are unwanted bushes and trees that have been planted with no permission. This is public land for public residence to use., 26th August
item.description:
Gardening team required maintenance cutting down large dead palm trees and dead bushes Hackney Council leaving them there for a number of years causing issues.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Daintry Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
